columns.id: A unique identifier for each building in the database.
columns.name: The name of the building, which serves as a reference for identification.
columns.City: The city where the building is located.
columns.Height: The height of the building in units, typically measured in feet or meters.
columns.Stories: The total number of floors in the building.
columns.Status: The current construction status of the building, indicating whether it is proposed, under construction, or on-hold.

buildings.table_description: The buildings table contains detailed information about various buildings, including their unique identifiers, names, locations, physical dimensions, number of stories, and current construction status.

columns.id: Unique identifier for each company in the table.
columns.name: The name of the company.
columns.Headquarters: The primary country where the company's headquarters is located.
columns.Industry: The sector in which the company operates.
columns.Sales_billion: Total sales revenue of the company measured in billions.
columns.Profits_billion: Total profits of the company measured in billions.
columns.Assets_billion: Total assets held by the company, measured in billions.
columns.Market_Value_billion: Total market value of the company, measured in billions.

Companies.table_description: The Companies table provides details about various companies, including their identification, financial performance, and operational industry, enabling analysis of corporate performance and sector presence.

columns.building_id: The unique identifier for each building where a company has its office.
columns.company_id: The unique identifier for each company that occupies an office space in a building.
columns.move_in_year: The year in which the company moved into the designated building.

Office_locations.table_description: The Office_locations table captures the relationship between companies and their respective office buildings, including the year of occupancy.
